N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 517.6 - Temporary transfer without order

State Regulations
(a) The commissioner may approve a transfer
without order between hospitals for a period of 30 days for a patient in need
of special medical or surgical care available at the receiving, but not the
sending, hospital. Such transfer shall not be extended beyond 30 days unless an
order of transfer is obtained pursuant to the provisions of section
517.4
of this Part. (b) Unless otherwise prohibited by court
order in specific cases, the commissioner may approve a transfer without order
from a hospital operated by the OMH to those institutes designated under
section
7.17
(b) of the Mental Hygiene Law as institutes
for the conduct of medical research on mental illness, for a period not to
exceed 60 days. Written consent to such transfer shall be obtained in
accordance with Part 27 of this Title. Such transfer shall not be extended
beyond 60 days unless an order of transfer is obtained pursuant to the
provisions of section
517.4
of this Part. The patient
shall be returned to the sending hospital upon the expiration of the authorized
transfer, but the patient shall be returned prior to such expiration upon the
request of the patient or of the person who has given consent on behalf of the
patient or upon the determination of the director of the institute that the
patient's presence at the institute is no longer needed. (c) The commissioner may approve a temporary
transfer without order for a patient who is required to appear at a court
hearing, from a hospital located outside the county of the court where such
hearing is scheduled to be heard to a hospital located within the county of the
court, if such transfer would significantly reduce inconvenience to the
patient. Such transfer shall be extended beyond 30 days only upon written
approval of the commissioner based upon a written request stating the reasons
for such extension. (d) The
commissioner or a designee thereof may approve a transfer without order from a
residential treatment facility for children and youth to a hospital, for a
period of up to 30 days, if the patient has a mental illness which is likely to
result in immediate serious physical harm to self or others, as defined in
section
517.3
(g) of this

Part, unless a specified program of services is provided to such patient, and
if such program is available at the receiving hospital but not at the
residential treatment facility. Such transfer shall not be extended beyond 30
days unless an order of transfer is obtained pursuant to the provisions of
section
517.4
of this Part. (e) When a patient's temporary transfer
without order is effected pursuant to this section, the sending hospital shall, no later than three days after such transfer, give written notice thereof to
the following parties: (1)
the nearest
relative of the patient; (2)
additional significant others who the patient has indicated should receive
notice of the patient's hospitalization and status; (3)
the patient's guardian, if any, if such
guardian is not included under paragraph (1) or (2) of this subdivision; and
(4)
the Mental Hygiene Legal
